isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400 MODELS - 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400 Model INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00021) - UNDER HOOD INSPECTION

svcproc.title: UNDER HOOD INSPECTION
svcproc.para: 13. Hood operation, opens and closes without interference.

item.para: Insure hood opens and closes without binding or interfering with other components.
Hood should be evenly aligned with the cowl and bumper.
Hood must be firmly attached.

svcproc.para: 14. Under hood inspect Air/ Brake/ Coolant/ Fuel/ Refrigerant/ Steering lines, hoses, and piping clearance from moving parts, sharp edges, heat sources, and chafing.

item.para: Air inlet and charge air cooler piping and hoses.
Brake lines - air and hydraulic.
Engine coolant pipes and hoses.
Engine fuel lines and piping.
Air conditioning refrigerant hoses and piping.
Power steering hoses and piping related to steering and brake system.
All clamps and clipping are secure and properly positioned.

svcproc.para: 15. Wiring harnesses are clear of moving parts, sharp edges, and heat sources. Relocate as needed.

item.para: Inspect wiring and harnesses, apply tie straps where required.
Insure clipping is secure and properly positioned.

svcproc.para: 16. Cotter keys/lock tabs are installed and properly spread on all steering/brake components and clutch linkage.

item.para: Inspect for missing, damaged, or improperly installed cotter keys/pins.

svcproc.para: 17. Steering shaft pinch bolt head twisted off at both ends of I-shaft.

item.para: Examine the steering intermediate shaft and ensure that the pinch bolt heads have been twisted off at both ends of the shaft.
Check that the engine oil level is within the operating range on the oil level gauge. If the oil level is below the range, add oil to bring near the full mark. DO NOT OVERFILL.

svcproc.para: 19. Automatic transmission fluid level, if so equipped.

item.para: With the park brake applied and the transmission in neutral, follow the fluid level checking procedures provided by the transmission manufacturer. Add fluid if required.

svcproc.para: 20. Proper coolant level and freeze protection.

item.para: Check that the coolant level is in the operating range within the coolant reservoir. Add proper coolant if required. Refer to Owners Manual for information on coolant specifications.
Measure freeze protection using a refractometer for glycol concentration. It should be -40°F ± 4.
Visually inspect the fluid level by removing the reservoir cap and noting where the fluid is on the level gauge. Fill if necessary. Refer to the Owners Manual for fluid specifications.

svcproc.para: 22. Brake master cylinder fluid level, if equipped.

item.para: Remove each cap and inspect that the fluid is to the bottom edge of the ring on each reservoir fill port. DO NOT FILL TO THE TOP OF THE RESERVOIR. Refer to the Owners manual for specifications.
